meanings.definition: Unwilling to give or spend; miserly.
meanings.sent1: My friend is so stingy, he never shares his snacks with anyone.
meanings.sent2: The stingy old man refused to donate any money to charity.
meanings.sent3: The stingy squirrel hoarded all the acorns for itself.
meanings.sent4: Her stingy attitude towards compliments left others feeling unappreciated.
meanings.sent5: The stingy landlord refused to fix the leaky faucet, causing more damage over time.

meanings.sent1: The stingy portion of food left me hungry for more.
meanings.sent2: The plant struggled to grow in the stingy soil of the desert.
meanings.sent3: The stingy amount of paint barely covered half of the wall.
meanings.sent4: His stingy allowance barely covered his basic expenses.
meanings.sent5: The stingy supply of pencils made it difficult for the students to complete their work.
